The Western Jin records: Sima Yan, styled An Shi, was a man from Wen in Hebei. He was the grandson of Wei's great general
and the son of Sima Zhao, the Minister of the Palace Guard and Chancellor of the State.
When Zhao died, Yan succeeded as king.
Emperor Yuan knew that the succession was fated.
He sent Grand Protector Zheng Chong to present the imperial seal and offer the throne.
Yan received the abdication with humility.
He became Emperor Wu.
He proclaimed the capital of Jin to be Luoyang and Chang'an.
They were the old Eastern and Western Capitals.
Emperor Wu reigned for fifteen years.
In the Xianning period, he ordered Sima Zhou to conquer Wu and capture Sun Hao.
He enfeoffed him as the Marquis of Guiming.
From the 24th year of Yong'an of the Later Han to the first year of the Gengzi era of the Taikang period of the Jin,
the nine provinces were once again unified.
Moreover, in the Huangwu period of Wu,
Lu Ji said:
From now on, another sixty years later,
the world will have the same tracks for carriages and the same written characters.
Sure enough, it was as Lu Ji said.
When Shu was pacified and Wu was destroyed, it had been about sixty years.
Twenty years later, in the beginning of Emperor Hui's Yongning era,
the way of governance declined and powerful warlords rose up.
King Zhao of Zhao rebelled and usurped the throne.
Zhang Gui followed suit and did not submit, seizing control of the Liang region.
The interior and exterior were in turmoil, and chaos gradually escalated.ğŸ”½Liu Yuan pacified Pinyang.

The Dharma is manifested through people.
